Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • Map

  • public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores the state of a map. x, y coordinates go from the top left of the map to the bottom right of the map.
    Version:
    2.1
    Author:
    Ryan Smith, Josiah Richards

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int GRID_DIMENSION

      static java.lang.String START_META_KEYWORD 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Map(int width, int height)
      Creates a map of a set width and height with no camera assigned yet.
      Map(int width, int height, Camera camera)
      Creates a map of a set width and height and uses a camera.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        public Map(int width,
           int height,
           Camera camera)
        Creates a map of a set width and height and uses a camera.
        Parameters:
        width - How many cells across the map should be.
        height - How many cells down the map should be.
        camera - The camera to use for rendering.

      • Map

        public Map(int width,
           int height)
        Creates a map of a set width and height with no camera assigned yet.
        Parameters:
        width - How many cells across the map should be.
        height - How many cells down the map should be.

                           Direction movedDir)
        Steps on all the entities and the cell at the position of steppedOnBy.
        Parameters:
        steppedOnBy - The moving entity that's stepping on the entities/cell.
        movedDir - The direction the moving entity moved.

        Returns:
        A list of entities at the grid position.

      • getEntitiesAt

        public java.util.ArrayList<Entity> getEntitiesAt(Vector2 position,
                                                 Entity ignore)
        Gets a list of entities that are at a given grid position apart from the entity, ignore.
        Parameters:
        position - The grid position to check.
        ignore - The entity to exclude from the list.
        Returns:
        A list of entities at the grid position(excluding ignore).
